00.orig_text: Apple announces Mac OS X Lion, iOS 5, and iCloud
00.text: Apple announces Mac OS X Lion, iOS 5, and iCloud

02.orig_text: At the company's own Worldwide Developers Conference (WWDC) keynote at the Moscone West center in San Francisco, Apple CEO Steve Jobs introduced the next generation of software products from Apple.
02.text: At the company's own Worldwide Developers Conference (WWDC) keynote at the Moscone West center in San Francisco, Apple CEO Steve Jobs introduced the next generation of software products from Apple.

03.orig_text: Apple unveiled Lion, the new version of their Mac OS X operating system for desktop and laptop computers that brings new features to the software.
03.text: Apple unveiled Lion, the new version of their Mac OS X operating system for desktop and laptop computers that brings new features to the software.

04.orig_text: They also demonstrated iOS 5, a new version of the operating system that powers iPhones, iPod Touches, and iPads.
04.text: They also demonstrated iOS 5, a new version of the operating system that powers iPhones, iPod Touches, and iPads.

05.orig_text: Alongside both announcements, Jobs also announced a new iCloud service to sync data among all devices.
05.text: Alongside both announcements, Jobs also announced a new iCloud service to sync data among all devices.

06.orig_text: All 5,200 participating developers will spend the rest of the week in workshops with Apple employees; developer releases of each product were made available today.
06.text: All 5,200 participating developers will spend the rest of the week in workshops with Apple employees; developer releases of each product were made available today.

07.orig_text: Mac OS X Lion will be shipped in July through the online Mac App Store available on Mac computers for US$29.
07.text: Mac OS X Lion will be shipped in July through the online Mac App Store available on Mac computers for US$29.

08.orig_text: According to Apple, the update adds over 250 new features to the OS.
08.text: According to Apple, the update adds over 250 new features to the OS.

09.orig_text: Employee Phil Schiller discussed new multitouch gestures along with a dynamic task manager named Mission Control that shows open applications.
09.text: Employee Phil Schiller discussed new multitouch gestures along with a dynamic task manager named Mission Control that shows open applications.

10.orig_text: During the keynote, Schiller said, ``The Mac has outpaced the PC industry every quarter for five years running and with OS X Lion we plan to keep extending our lead.``
10.text: During the keynote, Schiller said, ``The Mac has outpaced the PC industry every quarter for five years running and with OS X Lion we plan to keep extending our lead.``

11.orig_text: It also adds full support for the Mac port of the popular App Store, full screen applications, iOS-style app icon lists called Launchpad, and other iOS-like features including a revamped Mail and Auto Save among others.
11.text: It also adds full support for the Mac port of the popular App Store, full screen applications, iOS-style app icon lists called Launchpad, and other iOS-like features including a revamped Mail and Auto Save among others.

12.orig_text: Mac OS X Lion was announced at a different Apple event several months ago and will replace Mac OS X Snow Leopard, which was released in 2009.
12.text: Mac OS X Lion was announced at a different Apple event several months ago and will replace Mac OS X Snow Leopard, which was released in 2009.

13.orig_text: Soon after, the company also introduced the latest installment in its popular mobile operating system iOS.
13.text: Soon after, the company also introduced the latest installment in its popular mobile operating system iOS.

14.orig_text: The fifth version (iOS 5) introduces around 200 new features, including a revamped notification system, which combines messages and notifications from all applications installed on the user's device.
14.text: The fifth version (iOS 5) introduces around 200 new features, including a revamped notification system, which combines messages and notifications from all applications installed on the user's device.

15.orig_text: Scott Forestall, an Apple employee, also revealed that iOS devices would no longer require a computer for setup, allowing users to 'cut the cord' between their devices and PCs.
15.text: Scott Forestall, an Apple employee, also revealed that iOS devices would no longer require a computer for setup, allowing users to 'cut the cord' between their devices and PCs.

16.orig_text: Magazines and newspapers also have a new folder interface; the Twitter social network is now integrated significantly into iOS devices.
16.text: Magazines and newspapers also have a new folder interface; the Twitter social network is now integrated significantly into iOS devices.

17.orig_text: Improvements to the mobile Safari browser were also announced; tabbed browsing and a Reader feature introduce desktop-like functionality.
17.text: Improvements to the mobile Safari browser were also announced; tabbed browsing and a Reader feature introduce desktop-like functionality.

18.orig_text: Finally, new camera features are built in, including the ability to take snapshots from the lock screen, as well as iMessages, a new messaging platform for iPhones and iPads.
18.text: Finally, new camera features are built in, including the ability to take snapshots from the lock screen, as well as iMessages, a new messaging platform for iPhones and iPads.

19.orig_text: CEO Steve Jobs returned to the stage to reveal Apple's new cloud services offering, iCloud.
19.text: CEO Steve Jobs returned to the stage to reveal Apple's new cloud services offering, iCloud.

20.orig_text: The service integrates with Lion and iOS applications and syncs data between a user's iOS devices.
20.text: The service integrates with Lion and iOS applications and syncs data between a user's iOS devices.

21.orig_text: For example, calendar events created on a user's laptop would be sent to their iPhone through iCloud.
21.text: For example, calendar events created on a user's laptop would be sent to their iPhone through iCloud.

22.orig_text: Apps, books, documents, photos, and more purchased or created on one device will be shared with others.
22.text: Apps, books, documents, photos, and more purchased or created on one device will be shared with others.

23.orig_text: The service is intended to launch in the fall of 2011 alongside iOS 5 and will be available with 5 gigabytes (GB) of storage for 10 devices for free.
23.text: The service is intended to launch in the fall of 2011 alongside iOS 5 and will be available with 5 gigabytes (GB) of storage for 10 devices for free.

24.orig_text: Earlier this year, Apple opened a 500,000 square foot data center in North Carolina intended to facilitate this new service.
24.text: Earlier this year, Apple opened a 500,000 square foot data center in North Carolina intended to facilitate this new service.

25.orig_text: Jobs rounded the services off by unveiling a new iTunes feature that mirrors a user's library in the cloud, allowing them to listen and download music to authorized devices.
25.text: Jobs rounded the services off by unveiling a new iTunes feature that mirrors a user's library in the cloud, allowing them to listen and download music to authorized devices.

26.orig_text: ``We are going to demote the PC to just be a device.
26.text: ``We are going to demote the PC to just be a device.

27.orig_text: We are going to move the digital hub, the center of your digital life, into the cloud,`` said Steve Jobs during the keynote.
27.text: We are going to move the digital hub, the center of your digital life, into the cloud,`` said Steve Jobs during the keynote.

28.orig_text: iCloud and iOS 5 will be released in the fall of 2011; Apple announced no new hardware products.
28.text: iCloud and iOS 5 will be released in the fall of 2011; Apple announced no new hardware products.
